title: Seared Beef Steaks with Raspberry and Chilli Salsa

ingredients.item: 1 tbsp capers, drained, rinsed and chopped (optional)
1 red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
½ x 20g pack fresh mint, finely chopped (reserve a few leaves to garnish)

instructions.step: For the salsa, place the raspberries in a large bowl and add the onion, capers (if using) and chilli. Stir in the herbs.  Add the vinegar and 1 tablespoon of the oil and season with freshly ground black pepper. Use a fork to gently crush some of the raspberries and allow the juice to seep into the salsa. Set aside in a cool place (but preferably not the fridge) until ready to serve.  Cook the rice according to pack instructions.  Meanwhile, brush the steaks with the remaining oil and season. Heat a ridged griddle pan or non-stick frying pan until very hot then sear the steaks for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking (less for rare, more for well done).  Serve the steaks hot from the pan with a good dollop of the salsa and a helping of rice. Garnish with the reserved, torn mint leaves.
